settings.description: And why every supplement you've tried has been designed for someone else's body

You know that thing you do when you sit down?

Where you grab the front of your shirt and pull it away from your body. Just a little. So the fabric doesn't cling to your chest and show everything.

Or when you're standing and you casually cross your arms. Not because you're cold. Because it hides the chest.
Or when you're shopping for clothes online at 11 PM because you need another size up. And you're picking the ones with patterns or darker colors because they hide more.

You've been doing this shit for how long now? A year? Two years? More?

And here's the thing that really pisses you off: You've been trying to fix it.

You eat clean. You workout every now and then. You cut the drinking. You tried keto, tried intermittent fasting. You've spent hundreds—maybe thousands—on fat burners and thermogenics and all the shit they promise will "boost your metabolism."

And your body hasn't changed.
Sure, maybe you drop a few pounds here and there. Maybe your pants fit better for a week or two. Then it comes right back.

The chest stays soft. The belly won't flatten. And you're still pulling that shirt away from your body every time you sit down.

So you tell yourself the same thing every man tells himself when nothing's working:

Maybe it's my genetics. Maybe I'm not disciplined enough. Maybe I need to work harder. Maybe this is just what happens when you get older. Maybe I need to accept this is who I am now.

settings.heading: Here's What Nobody's Been Telling You

settings.description:
How is this different?

What I'm about to tell you is going to make you angry. But it's also going to finally explain why nothing has worked.

Every supplement you've tried. Every fat burner from GNC. Every thermogenic on Amazon. Every "scientifically proven" formula.

They were all designed for white men.

Not Black men. White men.

Every single one of them was based on research studies that used predominantly white male subjects. They took that data, built their formulas, and then sold them to everyone—including us—like all bodies work the same way.
Look the CTS Journal have found this studies are still skewed towards White Men primarly
But not only the CTS found this, also the Med Cell Press Journal found the same problem of misrepresentation.

But our bodies don't work the same way.

This isn't opinion. This isn't some conspiracy theory. This is documented scientific research that the supplement industry has been ignoring for decades.

Look at the studies that explain and justify how black men and white men have differences in how their metabolisms operate.

And it's been costing you results. Costing you money. And making you think you're the problem when you're not.

I call it The White-Male Research Trap. And once you understand it, everything that's been confusing you finally make sense.

By the time you finish reading this, you're going to know exactly why your body hasn't been responding. Not in some vague "everyone's different" way. But in specific, documented, scientific terms.

You're going to understand:
settings.text1: Why your chest fat won't go away no matter how many push-ups you do
settings.text2: Why your belly holds onto weight even when you're eating clean
settings.text3: Why you're exhausted by 2 PM every day despite doing everything "right"
settings.text4: Why those late-night cravings feel impossible to control

settings.description:
And more importantly—you're going to know what based on my research and experience actually works when you stop fighting your biology and start working with it.

Because here's what changes when you finally use a solution designed for YOUR body:
settings.text1: You stop pulling your shirt away when you sit down.
settings.text2: You stop crossing your arms to hide your chest.
settings.text3: You stop shopping for bigger sizes at midnight.
settings.text4: You look in the mirror and recognize yourself again.
settings.text5: You feel like the man you know you are. Not the man you've been settling for.

settings.heading: The Research They Don't Want You To Know About

settings.description:
I was at my barber's when it first clicked. Someone mentioned how they don't use the same hair products white guys use. Because our hair's different. Needs different products to work right.

And I thought: If our hair works differently... why would my metabolism work the same?

That question sent me digging. And what I found pissed me off.

Dr. Marcus Webb is a Black exercise physiologist who's spent 15 years studying metabolic differences. When I got him on the phone, he didn't sugarcoat it.

"The supplement industry has been failing Black men for decades," he said. "And most of them don't even realize it. They're using research that doesn't apply to us and wondering why their products don't work for everyone."

Here's what the research actually shows:

Your metabolism burns slower. The American Journal of Clinical Nutrition published studies showing Black men have a resting metabolic rate about 5% lower than white men. That's 80 calories per day you're not burning just existing. Almost 30,000 calories per year. Eight pounds of fat they're burning that you're not—just by sitting on the couch.

Your body stores fat instead of burning it. Research in Diabetes Care shows Black men have significantly higher rates of insulin resistance, even at the same body weight. Your body's constantly getting the signal to STORE fat, not burn it. That's why the belly won't go away no matter how clean you eat.

Your stress hormone won't drop. White men's cortisol follows a steep curve—high in the morning, low at night. Black men's cortisol? Flat curve. Stays elevated all day and into the night. That's why you get those cravings you can't control. Why the belly fat accumulates. Why you're always tired.

Your body burns carbs, not fat. Studies show we preferentially burn carbohydrates for fuel. Their bodies switch to fat-burning easier. Ours don't. So that stubborn fat stays locked in your cells while you're burning everything else.

Your estrogen is higher. Endocrinology research consistently shows Black men have higher estrogen levels than white men. And high estrogen in men creates that soft chest fat. The kind that makes you pull your shirt away when you sit down. The kind that makes you avoid taking your shirt off at all.

settings.heading: This Is Why You've Been Failing (And It's Not Your Fault)

settings.description:
Now think about every supplement you've bought. Every fat burner. Every thermogenic.

Did ANY of them mention these differences?

Did anyone say, "Hey, your metabolism burns 80 fewer calories per day than we designed this for. Your insulin resistance means your body's storing fat instead of burning it. Your cortisol curve is flat, so you're fighting elevated stress hormones 24/7. Your body prefers carbs to fat. And your estrogen is creating that chest fat."

No.

Because they were selling you a formula designed for someone else's body. A body that burns more calories at rest. A body with better insulin sensitivity. A body with cortisol that drops at night. A body that switches to fat-burning easier. A body with lower estrogen.

That's why it didn't work.

Not because you weren't disciplined enough. Not because you weren't working hard enough. Not because you're "getting old."

You were using the wrong formula. Period.

You wouldn't use white-guy hair products and expect them to work on your hair. Why would you use white-guy supplements and expect them to work on your metabolism?

settings.heading: Who's Really To Blame For This

settings.description:
Here's what makes me angry about all this.

The supplement industry didn't accidentally overlook Black men. They made a choice. A business choice.
It's easier to formulate one product for everyone than to address metabolic differences. It's cheaper to ignore the research than to create targeted solutions. It's more profitable to sell the same formula to everyone and blame YOU when it doesn't work.

"You're not disciplined enough. You need to work harder. You're not following the plan correctly."

Meanwhile, they're sitting on research that proves their formulas were never designed for your body in the first place.

Dr. Webb told me something I'll never forget: "The fitness industry loves to talk about 'science-backed' formulas. But they conveniently ignore the science that shows different populations have different metabolic profiles. Because acknowledging that would require effort. And effort costs money."

So they kept selling you the same supplements. The same thermogenics. The same fat burners. All based on research using white men.

And when it didn't work for you? They blamed YOU.

That shit stops today.

settings.heading: Why You Should Trust What I'm Telling You

settings.description:
Look, I get it. You've been burned before. You've bought the promises. Tried the supplements. Followed the programs.

You're skeptical. You should be.

So let me be clear about what I'm sharing with you: This isn't marketing. This is published research.

The metabolic rate difference? American Journal of Clinical Nutrition. 
The insulin resistance? Diabetes Care. 
The cortisol patterns? Multiple endocrinology studies. 
The fat-burning preference? Documented metabolic research. 
The estrogen levels? Consistent across endocrinology data.

This isn't some theory a supplement company cooked up to sell product. This is science that's been documented for years. The supplement industry just chose to ignore it.

Dr. Marcus Webb didn't create this research. He compiled it. He spent two years going through over 50 published studies on Black male metabolism with a team of researchers, nutritionists, and Black health advocates.

Their goal was simple: identify the specific metabolic differences making fat loss harder for Black men, then build a solution that actually addresses them.

Not another generic fat burner with different marketing. A formula specifically designed for how Black men's bodies actually work.

That's how Dryft™ was created.

settings.heading: How It Actually Works When The Formula Matches Your Biology
settings.description:
Dryft™ is the first supplement designed specifically for Black male metabolism. Every ingredient was chosen to target one of those five metabolic differences.

Instead of the typical caffeine-heavy stimulant approach most fat burners use, Dryft™ works by flipping three critical switches in your body:

Switch #1: The Metabolic Switch

Remember that 80-calorie daily deficit? Dryft™ contains Cayenne Pepper Extract and Grains of Paradise—two thermogenic compounds that boost your resting metabolic rate and activate brown adipose tissue. That's the "good fat" that burns the bad fat.

Clinical studies show Grains of Paradise increase energy expenditure by 137 calories per day and significantly reduce visceral fat. We're literally countering that metabolic disadvantage you were born with.

Result: Instead of feeling sluggish every morning, you wake up with energy. Your body starts burning calories the way it's supposed to.

Switch #2: The Insulin Switch

Your higher insulin resistance is why your body stores fat instead of burning it. Dryft™ contains Dihydroberberine—a highly absorbable compound that improves insulin sensitivity so your cells actually USE glucose for energy instead of storing it as fat.

We also included Lactobacillus gasseri—the only probiotic strain with clinical evidence for reducing belly fat. Studies show up to 8.5% reduction.

Result: Your body finally starts burning fat instead of storing it. That belly that wouldn't flatten no matter what you did? It starts shrinking.

Switch #3: The Hormone Switch

Your flat cortisol curve and high estrogen? Dryft™ targets both. Ashwagandha KSM-66—the gold-standard adaptogen—helps reduce cortisol by up to 28%. This stops the stress-driven cravings and fat storage.

DIM helps your body metabolize excess estrogen. Zinc and Boron support healthy testosterone production.

Result: You stop feeling drained all the time. The cravings you couldn't control? Gone. That chest fat? Finally shrinking. You start feeling like yourself again.
"Every ingredient addresses a specific, documented metabolic difference," Dr. Webb explained. "This isn't guesswork. It's targeted science. When the formula actually matches your biology, results happen.

settings.heading: What Happened When I Tried It

settings.description:
I'll be honest with you. I was skeptical as hell.

I'd wasted thousands of dollars on supplements over the years. Every bottle made big promises. None delivered.

But three things made me try Dryft™:

✅ One: The research made sense. For the first time, someone was actually explaining WHY nothing had worked. Not making excuses. Not blaming me. Explaining the actual metabolic science.

✅ Two: Dr. Webb wasn't some Instagram fitness guru. He'd published actual research papers. Worked with pro athletes. He knew what he was talking about.

✅ Three: They offered a 90-day money-back guarantee. Full refund if it didn't work. Don't even have to send the bottles back.

settings.heading: So I figured, what do I have to lose except the chest fat?
Why Your Chest Fat Won't Go Away No Matter What You Do.

settings.label: Week 1-2
settings.description: Nothing dramatic. Expected. Real change takes time.

settings.label: Week 3
settings.description: Woke up one morning and realized I had energy. Not jittery caffeine energy. Just... ready to move. Alert. Like my body had been running on half power and someone finally turned it all the way up.

settings.label: Week 6
settings.description: My wife said something while we were getting ready for bed. "Your chest looks different. Flatter." I thought she was being nice. But when I looked in the mirror... she was right. It was flattening out.

settings.label: 2 Months
settings.description: Down 8.5 pounds. Jeans I hadn't worn in two years fit again. Guy at work asked if I'd been hitting the gym harder. I wasn't. Same workout routine. But my body was finally responding.

settings.label: 3 Months
settings.description: Down 18 pounds total. Chest fat? Basically gone. Belly? Flatter than it's been in a decade. But here's what really got me: I wasn't pulling my shirt away when I sat down anymore. Didn't even realize I'd stopped doing it until my wife pointed it out.

And the craziest part? It wasn't hard. I didn't have to white-knuckle it. Didn't have to be more disciplined or sacrifice more or try harder.

I just needed the right tool for the job.

settings.description: I started asking around after my results. Turns out thousands of Black men were experiencing the same thing.

"I thought it was too late for me. Fifty-eight years old, figured my best years were behind me. Three months on Dryft™, I'm down 20 pounds. My doctor looked at my blood work and said, 'Whatever you're doing, keep doing it.' Blood sugar's better. Blood pressure's down. But honestly? The best part is I feel like myself again.

I was sleeping better. My wife keeps stealing my shirts now because they're all too big on me. Had to buy a whole new wardrobe. But I'm not complaining."

settings.description: "I run my own business. Stress is constant. I tried every fat burner you can think of. Every diet. Every program. Nothing worked and I kept blaming myself. Two months on Dryft™ and my chest is flattening out. I'm not avoiding mirrors anymore. I'm not buying bigger shirts to hide. I feel like the man I'm supposed to be."

settings.description: Over 47,000 Black men have tried Dryft™ since it launched. The reviews all say the same thing: "This finally works. Why didn't someone make this years ago?"

How can I get started?

You're at a decision point right now.

You can keep doing what you've been doing. Keep using supplements designed for someone else's body. Keep wondering why your results don't match the promises. Keep blaming yourself for not being disciplined enough or working hard enough.

And six months from now, you'll be exactly where you are today. Or worse. Still pulling your shirt away when you sit down. Still shopping for bigger sizes. Still crossing your arms to hide your chest.

Or you can try something that's actually built for your biology.
Dryft™ is offering a 90-day guarantee. Try it for three full months. If your chest isn't flattening, your energy isn't improving, your body isn't responding—get a full refund. Keep the bottles. No questions asked.

Why 90 days? Because real metabolic change takes time. They want you to experience the full transformation, not just see if you lose a few pounds in week one.

Why offer this guarantee? Because when the formula actually matches your biology, it works. Over 47,000 men are proof of that.

settings.heading: You Have Nothing To Lose Except The Weight

settings.description:
What do I have to lose?

Let's be real about what you're risking here.

If you try Dryft™ and it doesn't work? You get your money back. All of it. And you keep the bottles.
If you DON'T try it? You keep doing what hasn't been working. You keep using formulas designed for someone else. You keep wondering why your body won't change.

That's not a risk. That's a guarantee you'll stay exactly where you are.
Here's what I wish someone had told me years ago:

You're not broken. You're not lazy. You're not undisciplined. And you're not "just getting old."

You've been using the wrong playbook.

The supplement industry sold you solutions designed for white male metabolism and acted surprised when they didn't work for you. They blamed you for their failure. Made you think you were the problem.

But you're not the problem. The formula was the problem.

And now there's finally a formula designed for YOU. For how YOUR body actually works. For the metabolism YOU have, not the metabolism they wish you had.

When your biology works FOR you instead of against you, everything changes.

Your energy comes back. The weight comes off. You sleep through the night. You stop pulling your shirt away when you sit down. You stop avoiding mirrors. You look at yourself and recognize the man staring back.

You stop feeling like you're fighting your own body. And you start living like the man you know you are.

Dryft™ is specifically formulated for Black men's metabolism.

Every ingredient targets a documented metabolic difference. Over 47,000 men have already made the switch. They stopped using supplements designed for someone else. They started using one designed for them.
And their bodies finally responded.

The question isn't whether Dryft™ works. The question is: Are you next?
